Comments: Returns a string representing the corresponding file system path of this Uri.

invalid characters and semantics. Will *not* look at the scheme of this Uri.

Comments: Control if the action should show up in the context menu and where.
The context menu of the editor has these default:
navigation - The navigation group comes first in all cases.
1_modification - This group comes next and contains commands that modify your code.
9_cutcopypaste - The last default group with the basic editing commands.
You can also create your own group.
Defaults to null (don't show in context menu).

Comments: Sets the current model attached to this editor.
If the previous model was created by the editor via the value key in the options
literal object, it will be destroyed. Otherwise, if the previous model was set
via setModel, or the model key in the options literal object, the previous model
It is safe to call setModel(null) to simply detach the current model from the editor.

Comments: Control the rendering of line numbers.
If it is a function, it will be invoked when rendering a line number and the return value will be rendered.
Otherwise, if it is a truey, line numbers will be rendered normally (equivalent of using an identity function).
Otherwise, line numbers will not be rendered.
Members.Name: lineNumbers

Comments: Should the corresponding line be selected when clicking on the line number?
Members.Name: selectOnLineNumbers

Comments: Control the width of line numbers, by reserving horizontal space for rendering at least an amount of digits.
Members.Name: lineNumbersMinChars

Comments: Enable the rendering of the glyph margin.
Defaults to true in vscode and to false in monaco-editor.
Members.Name: glyphMargin

Comments: The width reserved for line decorations (in px).
Line decorations are placed between line numbers and the editor content.
You can pass in a string in the format floating point followed by "ch". e.g. 1.3ch.
Members.Name: lineDecorationsWidth

Comments: When revealing the cursor, a virtual padding (px) is added to the cursor, turning it into a rectangle.
This virtual padding ensures that the cursor gets revealed before hitting the edge of the viewport.
Members.Name: revealHorizontalRightPadding

Comments: Render the editor selection with rounded borders.
Members.Name: roundedSelection

Comments: Class name to be added to the editor.
Members.Name: extraEditorClassName

Members.Name: readOnly

Members.Name: scrollbar

Comments: Control the behavior and rendering of the minimap.
Members.Name: minimap

Comments: Control the behavior of the find widget.
Members.Name: find

Comments: The number of vertical lanes the overview ruler should render.
Members.Name: overviewRulerLanes

Comments: Controls if a border should be drawn around the overview ruler.
Members.Name: overviewRulerBorder

Comments: Control the cursor animation style, possible values are 'blink', 'smooth', 'phase', 'expand' and 'solid'.
Members.Name: cursorBlinking

Comments: Zoom the font in the editor when using the mouse wheel in combination with holding Ctrl.
Members.Name: mouseWheelZoom

Comments: Control the cursor style, either 'block' or 'line'.
Members.Name: cursorStyle

Comments: Disable the use of `will-change` for the editor margin and lines layers.
The usage of `will-change` acts as a hint for browsers to create an extra layer.
Members.Name: disableLayerHinting

Comments: Disable the optimizations for monospace fonts.
Members.Name: disableMonospaceOptimizations

Comments: Should the cursor be hidden in the overview ruler.
Members.Name: hideCursorInOverviewRuler

Comments: Enable that scrolling can go one screen size after the last line.
Members.Name: scrollBeyondLastLine

Comments: Enable that the editor will install an interval to check if its container dom node size has changed.
Enabling this might have a severe performance impact.
Members.Name: automaticLayout

Comments: Control the wrapping of the editor.
When `wordWrap` = "off", the lines will never wrap.
When `wordWrap` = "on", the lines will wrap at the viewport width.
When `wordWrap` = "wordWrapColumn", the lines will wrap at `wordWrapColumn`.
When `wordWrap` = "bounded", the lines will wrap at min(viewport width, wordWrapColumn).
Members.Name: wordWrap

Comments: Control the wrapping of the editor.
When `wordWrap` = "off", the lines will never wrap.
When `wordWrap` = "on", the lines will wrap at the viewport width.
When `wordWrap` = "wordWrapColumn", the lines will wrap at `wordWrapColumn`.
When `wordWrap` = "bounded", the lines will wrap at min(viewport width, wordWrapColumn).
Members.Name: wordWrapColumn

Comments: Force word wrapping when the text appears to be of a minified/generated file.
Members.Name: wordWrapMinified

Comments: Control indentation of wrapped lines. Can be: 'none', 'same' or 'indent'.
Defaults to 'same' in vscode and to 'none' in monaco-editor.
Members.Name: wrappingIndent

Comments: Configure word wrapping characters. A break will be introduced before these characters.
Members.Name: wordWrapBreakBeforeCharacters

Comments: Configure word wrapping characters. A break will be introduced after these characters.
Members.Name: wordWrapBreakAfterCharacters

Comments: Configure word wrapping characters. A break will be introduced after these characters only if no `wordWrapBreakBeforeCharacters` or `wordWrapBreakAfterCharacters` were found.
Members.Name: wordWrapBreakObtrusiveCharacters

Comments: Performance guard: Stop rendering a line after x characters.
Members.Name: stopRenderingLineAfter

Comments: Enable detecting links and making them clickable.
Members.Name: links

Types.Name: IConfigurationChangedEvent

Comments: A view zone is a full horizontal rectangle that 'pushes' text down.
The editor reserves space for view zones when rendering.
Types.Name: IViewZone

Comments: The line number after which this zone should appear.
Use 0 to place a view zone before the first line number.
Members.Name: afterLineNumber

Comments: The column after which this zone should appear.
If not set, the maxLineColumn of `afterLineNumber` will be used.
Members.Name: afterColumn

Comments: If set, the editor will attach a mouse down listener to the view zone and .preventDefault on it.
Members.Name: suppressMouseDown

Comments: The height in lines of the view zone.
If specified, `heightInPx` will be used instead of this.
If neither `heightInPx` nor `heightInLines` is specified, a default of `heightInLines` = 1 will be chosen.
Members.Name: heightInLines

Comments: The height in px of the view zone.
If this is set, the editor will give preference to it rather than `heightInLines` above.
If neither `heightInPx` nor `heightInLines` is specified, a default of `heightInLines` = 1 will be chosen.
Members.Name: heightInPx

Comments: The dom node of the view zone
Members.Name: domNode

Comments: An optional dom node for the view zone that will be placed in the margin area.
Members.Name: marginDomNode

Comments: Callback which gives the relative top of the view zone as it appears (taking scrolling into account).
Members.Name: onDomNodeTop

Comments: Callback which gives the height in pixels of the view zone.

Comments: The result position takes scrolling into account and is relative to the top left corner of the editor.
Explanation 1: the results of this method will change for the same `position` if the user scrolls the editor.

Warning: the results of this method are innacurate for positions that are outside the current editor viewport.
Members.Name: getScrolledVisiblePosition

Types.Name: CodeActionContext

Types.Name: CodeActionProvider

Comments: A snippet string is a template which allows to insert text
and to control the editor cursor when insertion happens.
A snippet can define tab stops and placeholders with `$1`, `$2`
and `${3:foo}`. `$0` defines the final tab stop, it defaults to
the end of the snippet. Variables are defined with `$name` and
`${name:default value}`. The full snippet syntax is documented
Types.Name: SnippetString

Comments: A completion item represents a text snippet that is
proposed to complete text that is being typed.
Types.Name: CompletionItem

Comments: The label of this completion item. By default
this is also the text that is inserted when selecting
Members.Name: label

Comments: The kind of this completion item. Based on the kind
an icon is chosen by the editor.
Members.Name: kind

Comments: A human-readable string with additional information
about this item, like type or symbol information.
Members.Name: detail

Comments: A human-readable string that represents a doc-comment.
Members.Name: documentation

Comments: A string that should be used when comparing this item
Members.Name: sortText

Comments: A string that should be used when filtering a set of
Members.Name: filterText

Comments: A string or snippet that should be inserted in a document when selecting
Members.Name: insertText

Comments: A range of text that should be replaced by this completion item.
Defaults to a range from the start of the [current word](#TextDocument.getWordRangeAtPosition) to the
*Note:* The range must be a [single line](#Range.isSingleLine) and it must
[contain](#Range.contains) the position at which completion has been [requested](#CompletionItemProvider.provideCompletionItems).
Members.Name: range

Comments: Represents a collection of [completion items](#CompletionItem) to be presented
Types.Name: CompletionList

Comments: This list it not complete. Further typing should result in recomputing
Members.Name: isIncomplete

Comments: The completion item provider interface defines the contract between extensions and
When computing *complete* completion items is expensive, providers can optionally implement
the `resolveCompletionItem`-function. In that case it is enough to return completion
when a completion item is shown in the UI and gains focus this provider is asked to resolve
Types.Name: CompletionItemProvider

Comments: Provide completion items for the given position and document.
Members.Name: provideCompletionItems

Comments: Given a completion item fill in more data, like [doc-comment](#CompletionItem.documentation)
The editor will only resolve a completion item once.
Members.Name: resolveCompletionItem

Comments: Describes how comments for a language work.
Types.Name: CommentRule

Comments: The line comment token, like `// this is a comment`

Comments: The block comment character pair, like `/* block comment */`
Members.Name: blockComment

Comments: The language configuration interface defines the contract between extensions and
various editor features, like automatic bracket insertion, automatic indentation etc.
Types.Name: LanguageConfiguration

Comments: This configuration implicitly affects pressing Enter around these brackets.
Members.Name: brackets

Comments: If the language supports Unicode identifiers (e.g. JavaScript), it is preferable
to provide a word definition that uses exclusion of known separators.
e.g.: A regex that matches anything except known separators (and dot is allowed to occur in a floating point number):
Members.Name: wordPattern

Comments: The language's rules to be evaluated when pressing Enter.
Members.Name: onEnterRules

Comments: The language's auto closing pairs. The 'close' character is automatically inserted with the
'open' character is typed. If not set, the configured brackets will be used.
Members.Name: autoClosingPairs

Comments: The language's surrounding pairs. When the 'open' character is typed on a selection, the
selected string is surrounded by the open and close characters. If not set, the autoclosing pairs
Members.Name: surroundingPairs

Comments: Describes indentation rules for a language.
Types.Name: IndentationRule

Comments: If a line matches this pattern, then all the lines after it should be unindendented once (until another rule matches).
Members.Name: decreaseIndentPattern

Comments: If a line matches this pattern, then all the lines after it should be indented once (until another rule matches).
Members.Name: increaseIndentPattern

Comments: If a line matches this pattern, then **only the next line** after it should be indented once.
Members.Name: indentNextLinePattern

Comments: If a line matches this pattern, then its indentation should not be changed and it should not be evaluated against the other rules.
Members.Name: unIndentedLinePattern

Comments: Describes a rule to be evaluated when pressing Enter.
Types.Name: OnEnterRule

Comments: This rule will only execute if the text before the cursor matches this regular expression.
Members.Name: beforeText

Comments: This rule will only execute if the text after the cursor matches this regular expression.
Members.Name: afterText

Comments: The string that starts a doc comment (e.g. '/**')
Members.Name: ``open``

Comments: The string that appears on the last line and closes the doc comment (e.g. ' * /').
Members.Name: close

Comments: Describes what to do when pressing Enter.
Types.Name: EnterAction

Comments: Describe what to do with the indentation.
Members.Name: indentAction

Comments: Describe whether to outdent current line.
Members.Name: outdentCurrentLine

Comments: Describes text to be appended after the new line and after the indentation.
Members.Name: appendText

Comments: Describes the number of characters to remove from the new line's indentation.
Members.Name: removeText

Comments: The state of the tokenizer between two lines.
It is useful to store flags such as in multiline comment, etc.
The model will clone the previous line's state and pass it in to tokenize the next line.
Types.Name: IState

Types.Name: Hover

editor will use the range at the current position or the

Types.Name: HoverProvider
